definition: to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: But love is a breeze compared to accelerating an audit.
sentences.chinese: 愛情需要和風細雨，但審計必須快馬加鞭。

sentences.english: At top speed, as the first monarch, young heroes.
sentences.chinese: 快馬加鞭，君爲先，自古英雄出少年。

sentences.english: Instantly he repented his life, put on his clothes in a hurry and rushed to the temple.
sentences.chinese: 他忽然深深懺悔，披衣而起，快馬加鞭，趕往寺裏。

sentences.english: I've been working like nobody's business to get it finished in time.
sentences.chinese: 爲按時完成任務，我一直在快馬加鞭地工作。

sentences.english: President-elect Barack Obama has quickly been filling posts in his Cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 美國當選總統奧巴馬一直在快馬加鞭地組建內閣。

sentences.english: Marriage rides upon the saddle and repentance upon the crupper.
sentences.chinese: 快馬加鞭奔婚禮，下得馬鞍悔已遲。

sentences.english: But he will have to move fast to rebuild the senior management.
sentences.chinese: 但是他必須快馬加鞭，趕緊把高層管理團隊建立起來。

sentences.english: That means you just have to jump in and get started.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着你只能快馬加鞭，重新開始。

sentences.english: We need to move forward very fast.
He whipped up the horse to the town.
sentences.chinese: 他快馬加鞭向城裏跑去。

definition: lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to be reluctant to give up a post
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
accomplice/accessory
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
to stake all on one throw
the road back to where one came from
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
protracted (idiom)/long and drawn-out
